page.title: 09CHALKNEY WOOD,EARLS COLNE
page.content: {Chalkney Wood}is mostly a deciduous wood dating from medieval times.There are 2 entrances and exits. Round the outside of the wood is about 5 miles walking,and staight though the middle from North to South is about 4 miles. There are some very nice walks there. It gets very muddy after a storm because horses go through the wood and also huntsmen go there.The huntsmen go there in the early morning,or late evening,and you here a gunshot and I think "1 rabbit down and hopefully, lots more to go!"We sometimes go blackberry picking in the wood,and we bring some home,and then we make apple and blackberry wine.There is a wide variety of flowers,and if you go for a walk you usually come home with a bunch of flowers.In May there is a carpet of bluebells.There are so many that it is hard not to tread on them.
